# Introduction

Can any noun be feminized with _`r trans("tA' al-ta'nIv")`_? Can any noun be used as a _`r trans("naet")`_? Will a _`r trans("naet")`_ always agree in number or gender?

These are some questions that we will attempt to answer. We start with a classification nouns primarily pieced together from different sections of [النحو الوافي]{lang=ar}. We follow this with a classification of the _`r trans("naet")`_ and its conditions. In these sections we will only present the information as we find it in the primary sources. Any comments from ourselves are restricted to within square brackets [] or footnotes.

Next, we look at case studies. We will use the classifications and conditions to determine the behavior of nouns we are studying.

The transcription scheme used in this article is _`r trans("'btvjHxdprzscSDTPegfqklmnhwy aui AUI aw ay")`_.

# Classification of nouns

## Basic categories

Nouns are classified^[_`r trans("al-naHw al-wAfI")`_, 3/181, footnote 1] as follows:

1. _`r trans("jAmid")`_: That which is not taken from another.
   1. _`r trans("ism pAt")`_: Concrete. Examples: [شجرة، قلم، أسد، حجر]{lang=ar}.
   2. _`r trans("ism maenA")`_: Abstract. Examples: [فَهْم، نبوغ، ذكاء، سماحة]{lang=ar}.
2. _`r trans("muctaqq")`_: That which is taken from another, which is its origin. Sometimes the _`r trans("muctaqq")`_ is referred to as the _`r trans("waSf")`_ or the _`r trans("Sifa")`_ but by this they don't mean [the syntactical category]: the _`r trans("naet")`_. The original _`r trans("muctaqqAt")`_ are seven:
1. _`r trans("ism al-fAeil")`_:
1. _`r trans("ism al-mafeUl")`_:
1. _`r trans("al-Sifa al-mucabbaha")`_:
1. _`r trans("afeal al-tafDil")`_:
1. _`r trans("ism al-zamAn")`_:
1. _`r trans("ism al-makAn")`_:
1. _`r trans("ism al-'Ala")`_:

There are also some _`r trans("jAmid")`_ nouns which sometimes are admitted to the _`r trans("muctaqq")`_ category. These are known as _`r trans("al-'asmA' al-jAmida al-mulHaqa bil-muctaqq")`_ or _`r trans("al-'asmA' al-muctaqqa ta'wIlan")`_. From these are:

1. _`r trans("ism al-'icAra")`_:
1. _`r trans("ism al-jAmid al-mansUb")`_:
1. _`r trans("ism al-jAmid al-muSaggar")`_:
1. Most of the _`r trans("al-mawSUlAt")`_:

These are only sometimes admitted to the _`r trans("muctaqq")`_ category. They are only admitted as such in places where only a _`r trans("muctaqq")`_ can be used, for example as _`r trans("naet")`_, because the _`r trans("naet")`_ basically has to be _`r trans("muctaqq")`_.

## The _`r trans("maSdar")`_

The _`r trans("maSdar")`_ can be either _`r trans("al-maSdar al-SarIHa")`_ or _`r trans("al-maSdar al-mu'awwal")`_. 

_`r trans("al-maSdar al-SarIH")`_ is considered the origin of the ten _`r trans("muctaqqAt")`_ (the seven mentioned above, and _`r trans("al-fiel al-maDI")`_, _`r trans("al-fiel al-muDArie")`_, _`r trans("al-fiel al-'amr")`_. As such, it is from _`r trans("al-'asmA' al-jAmida")`_.

_`r trans("al-maSdar al-SarIH")`_ is of three kinds^[_`r trans("al-naHw alwAfI")`_ 3/181]:

1. _`r trans("al-maSdar al-aSliyy")`_. It does not start with a supplemental _`r trans("mIm")`_ nor does it end with _`r trans("iyya")`_. Examples: [عِلْم، فَهْم، تقدُّم، استضاءة، إبانة، بلاء، نضال، فَضْل، صَلاح]{lang=ar}. It also includes the _`r trans("maSdar")`_ of _`r trans("al-marra wal-hay'a")`_.
2. _`r trans("al-maSdar al-mImiyy")`_. It starts with a supplemental _`r trans("mIm")`_ and it does not end with _`r trans("iyya")`_.The correct opinion is that it is not from the _`r trans("muctaqqAt")`_, rather it is _`r trans("jAmid")`_. Examples are [مَطْلَب، مَضْيَعة، مَجْلَبة، مَعْدَل]{lang=ar}. It must needs be singular.
2. _`r trans("al-maSdar al-SinAeiyy")`_. It is _`r trans("qiyAsiyy")`_, formed from any word (_`r trans("jAmid")`_ or _`r trans("muctaqq")`_, noun or non-noun) to which is appended _`r trans("iyya")`_. This appendage gives it a new meaning like [إنسانية]{lang=ar} "humanity" from [إنسان]{lang=ar} "human". It is a _`r trans("jAmid mulHaq bil-muctaqq")`_.

When the word _`r trans("maSdar")`_ is used by itself, by it is intended _`r trans("al-maSdar al-SarIH al-'aSliyy")`_.

### Patterns of _`r trans("al-maSdar al-aSliyy")`_^[_`r trans("al-naHw alwAfI")`_ 3/193]

_`r trans("al-maSdar al-aSliyy")`_ of form I verbs can be of the _`r trans("qiyAsiyy")`_ patterns: _`r trans("fael")`_, _`r trans("fieAla")`_, _`r trans("faeal")`_, _`r trans("fuela")`_, _`r trans("fueUl")`_, _`r trans("fueUla")`_, _`r trans("fieAl")`_, _`r trans("faealAn")`_, _`r trans("fueAl")`_, _`r trans("faeIl")`_, _`r trans("faeAla")`_. There are numerous other _`r trans("samAeiyy")`_ ones like  _`r trans("fuel")`_, _`r trans("faeAl")`_, _`r trans("faeala")`_. 

_`r trans("al-maSdar al-aSliyy")`_ of forms II and higher are found easily in grammar references.

### The _`r trans("maSdar")`_ and the _`r trans("ism al-maSdar")`_.

The _`r trans("maSdar")`_^[_`r trans("al-naHw alwAfI")`_ 3/207, footnote] (i.e., _`r trans("al-maSdar al-SarIH al-'aSliyy")`_) is a noun that indicates --by and large-- only an event. And it contains all the original and supplemental letters which comprise _`r trans("al-fiel al-maDI")`_ which is derived from it (excepting standard substitutions to form the regular forms (like [سَلَّمَ تَسْليمًا]{lang=ar}: _`r trans("taslIm")`_ has a _`r trans("tA'")`_ to substitute for one of the _`r trans("lAm")`_), substitutions for weak letters (like [عِدة]{lang=ar} for verb [وَعَدَ]{lang=ar}), and deletions due to frequency of usage). It may also contain additional letters, excepting those which form _`r trans("al-maSdar al-mImiyy")`_ and _`r trans("al-maSdar al-SinAeiyy")`_.

The definition includes two aspects: meaning and form. The aspect of meaning denotes only an event, no time, place, _`r trans("pAt")`_, proper noun, gender, or number (excepting that which is indicated by _`r trans("al-marra wal-hay'a")`_). The aspect of form defines what letters a _`r trans("maSdar")`_ must comprise.

The _`r trans("ism al-maSdar")`_^[_`r trans("al-naHw alwAfI")`_ 3/209, footnote] (which is limited to _`r trans("al-samAe")`_) is equivalent to the _`r trans("maSdar")`_ from the aspect of meaning but it differs in the aspect of form. It may not have all the letters of its _`r trans("al-fiel al-maDI")`_. Examples are [عَطاء]{lang=ar} for [إعطاء]{lang=ar}. 

The difference between the two in meaning is that the _`r trans("maSdar")`_ directly signifies to the verb event, while the _`r trans("ism al-maSdar")`_ directly signifies the _`r trans("maSdar")`_, thus indirectly signifying the verb event.

### Dualization and pluralization of the _`r trans("maSdar")`_^[_`r trans("al-naHw alwAfI")`_ 2/211]

The _`r trans("maSdar")`_ is not permitted to be dualized or pluralized as long as what is intended by it is just the meaning [of the verb], i.e. as long as it is _`r trans("mubham")`_. So we cannot say [صفحت عن المخطئ صفْحين]{lang=ar}, nor [وعدتُك وعودًا]{lang=ar}. Except if the _`r trans("maSdar")`_ ends with _`r trans("tA'")`_ _`r trans("marbUta")`_ in which it may be dualized and pluralized, e.g. ["التلاوتان والتلاوات"]{lang=ar}.

If however it is _`r trans("al-maSdar al-mubayyin li l-nawe")`_, when its _`r trans("anwAe")`_ are different, or _`r trans("al-maSdar al-mubayyin li l-eadad")`_, then it is permitted to dualize and pluralize it suitably. What is meant by "suitably" is if it satisfies the conditions of one of the three kinds of plurals ([جمع مذكر، جمع مؤنث سالم، جمع تكسير]{lang=ar}).

Example for _`r trans("al-maSdar al-mubayyin li l-nawe")`_: [سلكت مع الناس سُلُوكَيِ العاقل: الشدةَ حينًا والملاينةَ حينًا آخر. سرت سِيَرَ الخلفاء الراشدين]{lang=ar} meaning [سلكت مع الناس نوعين من السلوك العاقل: الشدة حينًا والملاينةَ حينًا آخر. وسرت معهم آنواعًا من السِيَر]{lang=ar}. What is intended here is not stating the number of times of [السلوك]{lang=ar}, and that it was twice, nor stating the numer of times of [السيْر]{lang=ar}, that it was many times. Rather, what is intended is stating the different kinds.

Example for the _`r trans("al-maSdar al-mubayyin li l-eadad")`_: [خطوت في الحديقة عشر خطوات، ودُرتُ في جوانبها أربع دوْرات]{lang=ar}

## Conditions of the _`r trans("jame mu'annav sAlim")`_

This plural may be applied with _`r trans("qiyAs")`_ on six nouns^[_`r trans("al-naHw alwAfI")`_ 1/168]:

1. All nouns that end in a _`r trans("tA' zA'ida")`_. This is absolute, whether it is 

   + an _`r trans("ealam")`_, like [فاطمة]{lang=ar}, 
   + or not an _`r trans("ealam")`_, like [زراعة، تجارة]{lang=ar}.
   + Feminine in form and meaning, like [حليمة، رقية]{lang=ar} from female names,
   + or feminine in form only, like [عطية، حمزة، معاوية]{lang=ar} from male names.
   + The _`r trans("tA'")`_ is from feminization as in the precding examples,
   + or for substituting an original [weak] letter, like [عِدة، ثُبة]{lang=ar}, which are pluralized as [عِدات، ثُبات]{lang=ar},
   + or even for emphasis, like [علّامة، علّامات]{lang=ar}.

   There are some exceptions like [امرأة، أَمَة، شاة، شَفَة، قُلّة، أُمّة، مِلّة]{lang=ar}.

2. All nouns that end in _`r trans("alif al-ta'nIv al-maqSUra 'aw al-mamdUda")`_. This applies for _`r trans("ealam")`_ or non-_`r trans("ealam")`_, male or female [names], Examples are [سُعدى]{lang=ar} for a female _`r trans("ealam")`_, [فُضْلى]{lang=ar} for a feminine _`r trans("Sifa")`_, [دُنيا]{lang=ar} when it is a male _`r trans("ealam")`_, [زَهراء]{lang=ar} for a female _`r trans("ealam")`_, [حسناء]{lang=ar} for a female _`r trans("Sifa")`_, and [زكرياء]{lang=ar} for a male _`r trans("ealam")`_.
   Excepted from this, according to the non-Kufans, are two forms [فَعْلى]{lang=ar} the feminine of [فَعْلان]{lang=ar} like [سَكْدى]{lang=ar} the feminine of [سكران]{lang=ar}, and [فَعْلاء]{lang=ar} the feminine of [أفْعَل]{lang=ar} like [خضراء وسوداء]{lang=ar} both of which are _`r trans("Sifa")`_ for feminine nouns, and not _`r trans("ealam")`_.

3. All _`r trans("ealam")`_ for female living beings which don't have an _`r trans("ealAma ta'nIv")`_, like [زينب، نوال، إحسان]{lang=ar}.

4. _`r trans("muSaggar")`_ for masculine nouns which are not _`r trans("eAqil")`_, like [نُهيرات]{lang=ar} the _`r trans("taSgIr")`_ of [نهر]{lang=ar}, and [جُبَيْلات]{lang=ar} the _`r trans("taSgIr")`_ of [جبل]{lang=ar}, and [مُعَيْدنات]{lang=ar} the _`r trans("taSgIr")`_ of [مَعْدن]{lang=ar}.

5. _`r trans("waSf")`_ for non-_`r trans("eAqil")`_ masculine nouns, like [هذه بساتين جميلات]{lang=ar}, (where for the singular we would have [بستان جميل]{lang=ar}) and [زرتها أيامًا معدودات]{lang=ar}.^[_`r trans("al-naHw al-wAfi")`_ does not mention this is only if the _`r trans("waSf")`_ is _`r trans("muctaqq")`_. We will try to explore this in the case studies.]

6. Every _`r trans("xumAsiyy")`_ for which a _`r trans("jame taksIr")`_ has not been heard from the Arabs, like [سُرادِقات، قَيصومات، حَمّامات، كتّانات، اصطبلات، قِطْميرات]{lang=ar} for [سُرادِق، قَيصوم، حَمّام، كتّان، اصطبل، قِطْمير]{lang=ar}.

Nouns which don't fall under these six categories are restricted to _`r trans("samAe")`_ like [شَمَالات]{lang=ar} for [شَمَال]{lang=ar}, the north wind.

## Feminization of nouns^[_`r trans("al-naHw alwAfI")`_ 4/590]

The _`r trans("tA' al-ta'nIv")`_ is introduced by _`r trans("qiyAs")`_ on the _`r trans("muctaqqAt")`_ to distinguish between the masculine and feminine. Examples are [عابِد وعابدة، عرّاف وعَرّافة، فَرِح وفَرِحة، مأمون ومأمونة]{lang=ar}. Even in the _`r trans("muctaqqAt")`_, the _`r trans("tA' al-ta'nIv")`_ is introduced on most nouns but not all. Some of the _`r trans("muctaqqAt")`_ do not admit it at all, according to the opinion of the majoity of the grammarians, while some admit it only sometimes.^[Examples are [حامل، صَبور]{lang=ar}, etc. These nouns, and the circumstances in which they accept or reject the _`r trans("tA' al-ta'nIv")`_, are well categorized and discussed in the reference grammars so I will not get into it here.]

There are other ways of feminizing nouns, like _`r trans("alif al-ta'nIv al-maqSUra")`_^[_`r trans("al-naHw alwAfI")`_ 4/600] and _`r trans("alif al-ta'nIv al-mamdUda")`_^[_`r trans("al-naHw alwAfI")`_ 4/603], both of which are _`r trans("samAean")`_. [These are always extraneous to the original radicals.]^[Also well discussed in the reference grammars].

The _`r trans("tA' al-ta'nIv")`_ is not introduced by _`r trans("qiyAs")`_ on _`r trans("'asmA' al-'ajnAs al-jAmida")`_, but it is sometimes found by _`r trans("samAe")`_ [for nouns denoting male and female living beings]. Examples are [رَجُل ورَجُلة، أَسَد وأسدة، فَتًى ،فتاة، غُلام وغلامة، امرؤ وامرأة، إنسان وإنسانة]{lang=ar}.

Most nouns denoting male and female living beings, however, have different words for them. Examples are [ثَور وبقرة، حِمار وأتان، تَيس وعنز]{lang=ar}. Sometimes the same word is used for living beings of both gender [although it may be grammatically of one gender]. Examples are [حمامة وفرس]{lang=ar}.^[_`r trans("euDw 'am euDwa, wa masA'il 'uxar")`_, _`r trans("lifaySal al-manSUr")`_]

# Classification of the _`r trans("naet")`_

The _`r trans("naet")`_ is classified^[_`r trans("al-naHw al-wAfI")`_, 3/458] with respect to its meaning into _`r trans("mufrad")`_, _`r trans("jumla")`_ and _`r trans("cibh jumla")`_.

The _`r trans("qiyAsiyy")`_ things which are correct as _`r trans("naet mufrad")`_ are:

1. _`r trans("al-'asmA' al-muctaqqa al-eAmila")`_
2. Or what is in [accordance with] their meaning.

By _`r trans("al-eAmila")`_ is meant

1. _`r trans("ism al-fAeil")`_:
1. _`r trans("Siyag al-mubAlaga")`_:
1. _`r trans("al-Sifa al-mucabbaha")`_:
1. _`r trans("ism al-mafeUl")`_:
1. _`r trans("afeal al-tafDil")`_:

Those [_`r trans("al-'asmA' al-muctaqqa")`_] which are not _`r trans("al-eAmila")`_, and which do not occur as _`r trans("naet")`_ are:

1. _`r trans("ism al-zamAn")`_:
1. _`r trans("ism al-makAn")`_:
1. _`r trans("ism al-'Ala")`_:

And what is meant by "what is in [accordance with] their meaning" is all _`r trans("al-'asmA' al-jAmida")`_ that are similar to _`r trans("al-'asmA' al-muctaqqa")`_ in what they signify in meaning. These are called _`r trans("al-'asmA' al-muctaqqa ta'wIlan")`_. The most common of these are:

1. _`r trans("'asmA' al-'icAra gayr al-makAniyya")`_, like [هذا]{lang=ar}. These are only _`r trans("al-naet")`_ to definite nouns. Example: [استمعت إلى الناصح هذا]{lang=ar}.

   The _`r trans("'asmA' al-'icAra al-makAniyya")`_ like [هُنا، ثَمّ]{lang=ar} are _`r trans("PurUf makAn")`_. They don't occur by themselves as _`r trans("naet")`_. But they may be attached to a _`r trans("maHpUf")`_ which will be the _`r trans("naet")`_. Example: [أسرع العِطاش إلى ماء هنا]{lang=ar}، i.e., [موجود هنا]{lang=ar}.

2. [ذو، المضافة]{lang=ar} 
meaning "the possessor of so-and-so". "It is a _`r trans("naet")`_ to indefinite nouns". (But some references say it may be a _`r trans("naet")`_ to definite nouns as well. Example: [أنِست بصحبة عالم ذي خلق كريم]{lang=ar}.

3. _`r trans("al-mawSUlAt al-ismiyya")`_ which begin with a _`r trans("hamzat waSl")`_. Examples: [الذي، التي، اللائي]{lang=ar}. As opposed to the _`r trans("mawSUla")`_ [أي]{lang=ar}.

   There is some dispute regarding [مَنْ]{lang=ar} and [ما]{lang=ar} being _`r trans("naet")`_. The correct opinion is that it is permissible for them to be _`r trans("naet")`_. 

   Examples: [الضعيف الذي يحتدس من عدوه، أقرب إلى السلامة من القوي الذي ينخدع، أو يستهين]{lang=ar}. The meaning is [الضعيف المحتدس من عدوه، أقرب إلى السلامة من القوي المنخدع، ...]{lang=ar}. Thus its meaning is that of the _`r trans("muctaqq")`_.

4. _`r trans("al-ism al-jAmid")`_ which signifies _`r trans("al-nasab")`_ in purpose. The most common forms are those which end in _`r trans("iyy")`_; or those on the measure _`r trans("faeeAl")`_, other measures which signify _`r trans("al-intisAb")`_ in purpose. Examples: [ألْمحُ في وجه الرجل العربيّ كثيرًا من أمارات الصراحة، والشجاعة، والكفاح، اشتهر الرجل اليوناني بالنشاط ،الهجرة إلى حيث يتسع الرزق أمامه، وفي بلادنا جماعة منهم تمارس الحِرَف والصناعات المختلفة. فتجد بينهم التاجر والبقال واللبان والحداد ... و ...]{lang=ar}^[The nouns denoting professions don't seem to be _`r trans("naet")`_ in this sentence, so perhaps they are listed to give examples of the nouns, not their use as _`r trans("naet")`_.]

   These kinds of nouns can correctly be _`r trans("naet")`_ for both definite and indefinite nouns.

5. _`r trans("al-muSaggar")`_: because it includes a description in its meaning. In this respect it is similar to the _`r trans("nasab")`_. And therefore they are admitted to _`r trans("al-muctaqq")`_.

6. _`r trans("al-ism al-jAmid al-maneUt bi l-muctaqq")`_. Example [اقتديت برجلٍ رجلٍ شريفٍ]{lang=ar}. This kind of _`r trans("naet")`_ is also called _`r trans("al-naet al-muwaTTi'")`_.

7. _`r trans("al-maSdar")`_: with the conditions that it be:
   1.  indefinite,
   2. _`r trans("al-maSdar al-SarIH")`_,
   3. not _`r trans("al-maSdar al-mImiyy")`_,
   4. not used as a _`r trans("Talab")`_ (like[قيامًا للضيف]{lang=ar} meaning [قم للضيف]{lang=ar}),
   5. the _`r trans("al-maSdar")`_ of a form I verb, and
   6. that it retain its original form with respect to its singularity، masculinity (excepting _`r trans("maSAdir")`_ which have an original _`r trans("tA' al-ta'nIv")`_ like [رحمة، شفقة]{lang=ar}).
      If, however, the use of the _`r trans("maSdar")`_ as a _`r trans("naet")`_ becomes common then is permisible to dualize or pluralize it _`r trans("qiyAsiyyan")`_. An example is the poet's verse:  
      [وبايعتُ ليلى في الخلاءِ ولم يكن = شهودٌ على ليلى، عدولٌ مَقانعُ]{lang=ar}
      ^[The word [عُدول]{lang=ar} here is regularly the plural of the _`r trans("maSdar")`_ [عَدْل]{lang=ar} not of [عَادِل]{lang=ar} whose plural would regularly be [عَدَلة]{lang=ar}. Although there exist exceptions like [شاهق شُهوق ،راقد رقود، ساجد سجود]{lang=ar}. This information was provided by forum member [زهرة متفائلة]{lang=ar} at the alfaseeh.com forum.]

   Example: [رأيت في المحكمة قاضيًا عدْلا وشهودا صدْقًا ونظامًا رِضًا وجموعًا زَوْرًا بين النتقاضين]{lang=ar} meaning [قاضيًا عادلا وشهودا صادقين ونظامًا مرضيًّا وجموعًا زائرة بين النتقاضين]{lang=ar}

   The _`r trans("maSdar")`_ can be a _`r trans("taqdIr muDAf maHpUf")`_ 
which is the _`r trans("naet")`_. That is, originally it is [قاضيًا  صاحبَ عدل...]{lang=ar}

   The grammarians differed with respect to the _`r trans("maSdar")`_ occurring as a _`r trans("naet")`_, whether it is _`r trans("qiyAsiyy")`_ or restricted to _`r trans("al-samAe")`_. Most of them restricted it to _`r trans("al-samAe")`_, although they acknowledged that it does appear a lot in the corpus, and that it is _`r trans("'ablag")`_ than the _`r trans("muctaqq")`_. This acknowledgement that it appears a lot contradicts their restricting it to _`r trans("al-samAe")`_. The correct opinion should then be to take it _`r trans("qiyAsiyyan")`_ with its conditions.

   Note: the scholars of _`r trans("balAga")`_ have proclaimed that _`r trans("al-naet bi l-maSdar")`_ is from the category of _`r trans("al-mubAlaga")`_, or from _`r trans("majAz al-Hapf")`_, or _`r trans("al-majAz al-mursal")`_, and that the _`r trans("vulAviyya")`_ is _`r trans("qiyAsiyy")`_. How can the scholars contradict each other, where the the scholars of _`r trans("balAga")`_ say that _`r trans("al-naet bi l-maSdar")`_ is _`r trans("ablag")`_ than the _`r trans("muctaqq")`_ at the same time that some of the grammarians say that _`r trans("al-naet bi l-maSdar")`_, despite its frequency in the corpus, is not _`r trans("qiyAsiyy")`_? How can they say this when the Quran, the most eloquent of speech, contains it multiple times? This contradiction can only be resolved by saying that _`r trans("al-naet bi l-maSdar")`_ is  _`r trans("qiyAsiyy")`_ with the aforementioned conditions. _`r trans("ibn jiniyy")`_ in his book _`r trans("al-muHtasab")`_ (vol. ii, p. 46) says, "The usage  of _`r trans("al-maSdar")`_ as a _`r trans("naet")`_ directly, without _`r trans("taqdIr bicay' maHpUf")`_ is _`r trans("'ablag")`_ and _`r trans("'alTaf")`_ than the _`r trans("naet")`_ which is not a _`r trans("maSdar")`_." he supports this claim with multiple evidences, and presents many quotations.

8. _`r trans("ism al-maSdar")`_ if it is of a _`r trans("vulAviyy")`_ measure. Examples [فِطْر]{lang=ar} _`r trans("ism al-maSdar")`_ of the verb [أفطر]{lang=ar} meaning [مُفْطِر أو صاحب إفطار]{lang=ar}. You can say [هذا رجلٌ فًطْر، ورجلان فِطْر، ورجال فِطْرٌ]{lang=ar}.

9. _`r trans("al-eadad")`_: like [قرأت كتبًا سبعةً، وكتبت صحفًا خمسةً]{lang=ar}.

10. Some other words that are _`r trans("jAmid mu'awwal bi l-muctaqq")`_, connoting perfection or deficiency, like the word [كُلّ]{lang=ar}, e.g. [عرفت العالِمَ كُلَّ العالمِ]{lang=ar}

11. The _`r trans("jAmid")`_ that signifies _`r trans("al-Sifa al-mucabbaha")`_ together with its acceptability as _`r trans("al-ta'wIl bi l-muctaqq")`_. Examples [فلانٌ رجلٌ فَراشةُ الحِلمِ، فِرعونُ العذابِ، غِربالُ الإهابِ]{lang=ar}. The words [فَراشةُ، فِرعونُ، غِربالُ]{lang=ar} are analyzed as _`r trans("naet bi l-muctaqq")`_, because they mean [أحمق، قاسٍ، حقير]{lang=ar} respectively.

    These^[_`r trans("al-naHw al-wAfI")`_, 2/284] are _`r trans("qiyAsiyy")`_ but it is better to employ them as such as little as possible. They may have a supplemental geminated _`r trans("yA' li l-nasab")`_ that brings them closer to the _`r trans("muctaqqAt")`_. Example [تناولنا شرابًا عسلًا طعْمُه]{lang=ar} or [تناولنا شرابًا عسليًّا طعْمُه]{lang=ar}.

## Some additional information with respect to the _`r trans("naet")`_

### Definite _`r trans("maSdar")`_ as _`r trans("naet")`_^[_`r trans("al-naHw al-wAfI")`_, 3/464]

Regarding the condition that the _`r trans("maSdar")`_ be indefinite if it occur as _`r trans("naet")`_: It is sometimes found in the corpus as definite: either with _`r trans("al")`_ or as _`r trans("muDAf li maerifa")`_. An example with _`r trans("al")`_ is the word [الحقّ]{lang=ar} in the poet's verse:

[إن أخاك الحقَّ من يسعى معكْ = ومن يضرّ نفسه لينفعكْ]{lang=ar}

Examples of _`r trans("muDAf li maerifa")`_ are [مررت برجل حسبِك من رجل أو شَرْعِك أو كافيك أو همِّك أو نحوِك]{lang=ar}. These ought to be definite by _`r trans("'iDAfa")`_ but they don't become definite because they are in the meaning of a _`r trans("muctaqq")`_ and that they are a _`r trans("naet")`_ to an indefinite.^[The definiteness of [الحقّ]{lang=ar} seems to be unexplained. And we shall find another, albeit later [in history], example of this in the next sections.]

Another such example is the Quranic aayah [هذا عارضٌ مُمْطِرُنا]{lang=ar}.The word [عارضٌ]{lang=ar} is described by [مُمْطِرُنا]{lang=ar} which is _`r trans("muDAf 'ilA DamIr")`_ therefire it does not become definite.^[_`r trans("al-DamA'ir")`_ are definite but it seems, exceptionally, an _`r trans("'iDAfa")`_ to them does not make the _`r trans("'muDAf")`_ definite by occurring as a _`r trans("'naet")`_ to an indefinite.]

### Examples _`r trans("naet")`_ not falling under the preceding classification.^[_`r trans("al-naHw al-wAfI")`_, 3/465]

Some examples of _`r trans("naet")`_ of are found in the corpus which don't fall under the preceding classification. For example:

1. A _`r trans("maSdar")`_ of a non-form I verb, e.g. [الحازم لا يعلج الأمر عِلاجًا التجالا]{lang=ar}.
2. A _`r trans("naet")`_ signifying quantity, e.g. [اشتريت من الفاكهة الخمسَ الأقَقَ]{lang=ar}.
2. A _`r trans("naet")`_ signifying material of a manufactured object, e.g. [لبست الثوبَ الحريرَ]{lang=ar}.
4. A _`r trans("naet")`_ signifying _`r trans("al-'aeyAn")`_ of whom _`r trans("ta'wIl")`_ is possible, e.g. [حصدتَ الحقل القمح]{lang=ar} meaning [المزروع قمحًا]{lang=ar}.

It is best that _`r trans("qiyAs")`_ not be done on these examples.

### _`r trans("ism al-'icAra")`_ as _`r trans("naet")`_ or _`r trans("maneUt")`_^[_`r trans("al-naHw al-wAfI")`_, 3/465]

There are some nouns that are correct as _`r trans("naet")`_ when they satisfy the conditions of _`r trans("naet")`_; and other times as _`r trans("maneUt")`_ when they satisfy the conditions of _`r trans("maneUt")`_. Like _`r trans("ism al-'icAra")`_. For example, [احتفيت بالمصلح هذا]{lang=ar} or [بهذا المصلح]{lang=ar}.

Also, _`r trans("ism al-'icAra")`_ is definite so it can only be a _`r trans("naet")`_ for a definite noun. And when it is a _`r trans("maneUt")`_, its _`r trans("naet")`_ must have the _`r trans("al")`_ of definiteness. (And it is better that it be _`r trans("muctaqq")`_. If however, it is _`r trans("jAmid")`_, then it is better that it is considered a _`r trans("badal")`_ or _`r trans("eaTf bayAn")`_ rather than a _`r trans("naet")`_.) It is also required that it match its _`r trans("maneUt")`_ in number and gender, and without separating the _`r trans("naet")`_. It should also not be separated from its _`r trans("maneUt")`_, and that it match it in case.

### _`r trans("al-ealam")`_ and _`r trans("al-'ajnAs")`_ as _`r trans("naet")`_^[_`r trans("al-naHw al-wAfI")`_, 3/466]

_`r trans("al-ealam")`_ may not be _`r trans("naet")`_, nor _`r trans("al-'ajnAs")`_ which signify their original meaning like [رجل ونمر وفيل]{lang=ar}. However, if they (_`r trans("al-ealam")`_ and _`r trans("al-'ajnAs")`_) leave their original signification, and a well-known description is intended by them, then it is permissible for them to be _`r trans("naet")`_. For example [حاتم]{lang=ar} signifies [الكرم]{lang=ar}, and [الرجل]{lang=ar} signifies [الكامل]{lang=ar}, and  [النمر]{lang=ar} signifies [الغادر]{lang=ar}. In this purpose, they may be interpreted as _`r trans("mactaqq")`_.

# Case studies

In this section we will consider how to use the above classifications and rules for specific examples. Regarding the usage of nouns as _`r trans("SifAt")`_, we will only consider whether they may be "apparent _`r trans("SifAt")`_". This is because the grammarians, for example, will not allow a definite _`r trans("maSdar")`_ to be a _`r trans("Sifa")`_. But for apparent examples of this in the corpus, they will analyze it using tools like _`r trans("maHpUf")`_ and _`r trans("taqdIr")`_. They are justified in this analysis because they are building a cohesive minimal framework for grammar. As for us, we will only consider the suitability of a noun as an "apparent _`r trans("Sifa")`_" without worrying about its technical grammatical function.

## Can masculine _`r trans("'asmA' jAmida")`_ be used for females
There are some masculine _`r trans("'asmA' jAmida")`_ like [شَخْص]{lang=ar} "person" and [عُضْو]{lang=ar} "member", which can be applied to female persons. Since they are _`r trans("'asmA' jAmida")`_, they can not be feminized with _`r trans("tA' al-ta'nIv")`_ except _`r trans("samAean")`_. Therefore, they will used in their original masculine form but other nouns around them should be feminized whereever applicable. Examples:

[هي عضوٌ داىمةٌ للجنة ]{lang=ar}  
She is a permanent member of the committee.

We also find the following in _`r trans("al-'uSUl fi l-naHw li -bn sarrAj")`_:

::: {lang=ar}
> من ذلك قول الشاعر:  
> فكانَ مِجَنّي دونَ مَنْ كنتُ أتقّي = ثَلاثُ شُخوصٍ كاعبانِ ومُعْصِرُ
>
> فإنما أنّث الشخوص لقصده النساءَ فحمله على المعنى، ثُمّ أبانَ عن إرادته وكشفَ عن معناه بقوله: كاعبانِ ومُعْصِرُ
^[_`r trans("al-'uSUl fi l-naHw li -bn sarrAj")`_ 3/476]
:::

## Usage of _`r trans("al-maSAdir")`_ as designative nouns and as _`r trans("naet")`_

### The definite _`r trans("maSdar")`_ as a _`r trans("naet")`_

In the aformentioned conditions _`r trans("maSdar")`_ may only be a _`r trans("naet")`_ if it is indefinite. However, we find, for example the word [ثقة]{lang=ar} meaning "trustworthy", in the books of the sciences of _`r trans("HadIv")`_, that it also appears as a definite _`r trans("naet")`_. This is a technical usage and arguably it not from "_`r trans("kalaam al-earab")`_", nevertheless it is found. Example^[[المسند للإمام أحمد]{lang=ar}, vol. 6, p. 24]:

::: {lang=ar}
 6474 م- قال شُعْبة وذَكر لي رجلٌ ثقةٌ عن سفيان أنه كان يقول: إنما قال: "من كان متَحريَها فلْيَتَحرها في السَّبْع البَواقي"، قال شُعْبة: فلا أدري قال ذا أو ذا؟، شُعْبة شَك.
[قال عبد الله بن أحمد]: قال أبي: الرجلُ الثقةُ: يحيى بن سعيد القَطَّان.
:::
